name: Google Maps - Always a way home
description:
Recently my SO drove out for a hike out in the mountains. The last 45mins of the drive was on a fire road with no service. Google Maps brought her to the trailhead no problem.


However, when it came time for her to head home, she couldn't use Maps because she had no service.


She had to remember her way back home until she got service again. She also wasn’t able to find any food off her route until she had service (duh).


She said: ” Well Google can get me there when I headed to the trail, why can’t it save a route home for the way back?”


Let's find out!
